alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 12:21AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 315 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1218 AM HST, radar indicated persistent moderate to heavy showers moving over windward portions of Maui, affecting both windward Haleakala and windward west Maui. Rainfall rates near 1 inch per hour are leading to localized ponding of water on roadways while stream gages indicate rising water levels. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pauwela, Huelo, Paia, Keanae, Nahiku, Wailuku, Waiehu, Waihee, Kipahulu and Hana. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 315 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action.
